To our students: Please do not go out tonight after curfew. It will be very dangerous. There are reports that the vast majority of people who are inciting violence and burning areas of neighborhoods are not from Minnesota. The Governor has suggested that the National Guard will use whatever force necessary to stop it. We are thinking about you and we are very concerned for your safety.

Please be safe, students. We are fighting for you and with you, and we want you to be safe. If you are going out to protest, please do it during the day, and go home at curfew.

There is nothing more important than your safety. We know you are going through a lot and you are feeling many emotions. We are here to support you in every way we can.

Stay safe and take care.

We’re sharing tips for parents during the pandemic:
⬩Take time to talk with your child about the outbreak. Answer questions and share facts in a way that your child can understand.
⬩ Reassure your child that they’re safe. Let them know it’s OK if they feel upset. Share with them how you deal with your own stress so that they can learn how to cope from you.
⬩ Limit your child’s exposure to media coverage of the event. Children may misinterpret what they hear. They can be frightened about something they don’t understand.
⬩ Help him/her have a sense of structure. Plan a visual schedule for the day: introduce it in the morning then work your way through it. This helps with anxiety and unexpected change.
